item.description:
Hi folks! Spring is officially rocking and rolling! Let's get out and enjoy the show while we burn off some winter calories in the company of friends.

LOCATION: This Meetup will take place at Sleeping Giant, which is a Connecticut State Park located in Hamden.

PLAN: Sleeping Giant is a great park for any level of hiking. We'd like to walk the tower trail, which is relatively short, has a mild incline, and requires very little maneuvering over rocky places. We will have a break at the tower for snacks and chit chat, and we can split up into two groups after our break -- some members walking back down the tower road, and other members heading down the blue trail, if they desire a greater challenge. The two groups can converge at the parking lot after the hike.

WHEN AND WHERE: Meet at the entrance, which is located on Mt. Carmel Avenue, between 11:45 and noon, and we'll try to get rolling onto the trail by five minutes after 12. This particular hike shouldn't take more than 2 hours, with the break, and will be energizing without exhausting us.

BRING: water and a snack

WEAR: Hiking or other sturdy shoes with treads; layers of clothing.

COST: We ask for a donation of one dollar, towards the monthly fee that is charged by the Meetup Website. Please bring any contributions with you on the day of the hike.

DIRECTIONS: Please see link below.

PARKING NOTE: The DEP sometimes charges a fee to park in the lot. Please take advantage of the street parking on Mt. Carmel Avenue, adjacent to park, ACROSS FROM (not inside) Quinnipiac University.

Link to park website (with map):
Sleeping Giant State Park Website

Trail maps are usually available at the entrance, if you are interested.

group.name: New Haven Walks in the Woods

item.name: New Haven Early-bird Hiking Last-Minute Make-up Meetup
